gov.usgs.anss.edgeoutput

Class TraceBufPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.edgeoutput.TraceBufPool

  • public class TraceBufPool
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages a pool of miniseed blocks allowing them to be allocated (and created if the pool is empty), and marked free. The CWBQuery uses this so that new MiniSeed blocks to not have to be constantly created and destroyed which excites the garbage collector to no end.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      TraceBufPool(int initSize, int tbSz, EdgeThread parent)
      A TraceBuf pool creates TraceBufs and allows callers to allocate one or free one.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TraceBufPool

        public TraceBufPool(int initSize,
            int tbSz,
            EdgeThread parent)
        A TraceBuf pool creates TraceBufs and allows callers to allocate one or free one. All of the TraceBufs are managed on the free list and used list
        Parameters:
        initSize - Number of trace bufs to initially allocate
        tbSz - The size in bytes of the tracebuf buffers
        parent - A logging thread if desired.
